==Events==
*[[38 BC]] &ndash; [[Octavian]] divorces his wife [[Scribonia]] and marries [[Livia Drusilla]], ending the fragile peace between the [[Second Triumvirate]] and [[Sextus Pompey]].
* [[395]] &ndash; Emperor [[Theodosius I]] dies in [[Milan]], the [[Roman Empire]] is re-divided into an eastern and a western half. The [[Byzantine Empire|Eastern Roman Empire]] is centered in [[Constantinople]] under [[Arcadius]], son of Theodosius, and the [[Western Roman Empire]] in [[Mediolanum]] under [[Honorius (emperor)|Honorius]], his brother (aged 10).
*[[1287]] &ndash; King [[Alfonso III of Aragon]] invades [[Minorca]].
*[[1377]] &ndash; [[Pope Gregory XI]] moves the Papacy back to Rome from [[Avignon]].
*[[1524]] &ndash; [[Giovanni da Verrazzano]] sets sail westward from [[Madeira]] to find a sea route to the Pacific Ocean.
*[[1562]] &ndash; France recognizes the [[Huguenot]]s by the [[Edict of Saint-Germain]].
*[[1595]] &ndash; [[Henry IV of France]] declares war on Spain.
*[[1608]] &ndash; [[Emperor of Ethiopia|Emperor]] [[Susenyos of Ethiopia|Susenyos]] surprises an [[Oromo people|Oromo]] army at Ebenat; his army reportedly kills 12,000 Oromo at the cost of 400 of his men.
*[[1648]] &ndash; England's [[Long Parliament]] passes the "[[Vote of No Addresses]]", breaking off negotiations with [[Charles I of England|King Charles I]] and thereby setting the scene for the second phase of the [[English Civil War]].
*[[1773]] &ndash; Captain [[James Cook]] and his crew become the first Europeans to sail below the [[Antarctic Circle]].
*[[1781]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Battle of Cowpens]] &ndash; Continental troops under Brigadier General [[Daniel Morgan]] defeat British forces under Lieutenant Colonel [[Banastre Tarleton]] at the battle in [[South Carolina]].
*[[1799]] &ndash; [[Malta|Maltese]] patriot [[Dun Mikiel Xerri]], along with a number of other patriots, is executed.
*[[1811]] &ndash; [[Mexican War of Independence]]: In the [[Battle of Calderón Bridge]], a heavily outnumbered [[Mid-19th-century Spain|Spanish]] force of 6,000 troops defeats nearly 100,000 Mexican revolutionaries.
*[[1852]] &ndash; The United Kingdom recognizes the independence of the [[Boer]] colonies of the [[South African Republic|Transvaal]].
*[[1873]] &ndash; A group of [[Modoc people|Modoc]] warriors defeats the [[United States Army]] in the [[First Battle of the Stronghold]], part of the [[Modoc War]].
*[[1885]] &ndash; A British force defeats a large [[Dervish]] army at the [[Battle of Abu Klea]] in the [[Sudan]].
*[[1893]] &ndash; The [[Committee of Safety (Hawaii)|Citizen's Committee of Public Safety]], led by [[Lorrin A. Thurston]], overthrows the government of Queen [[Liliuokalani]] of the [[Kingdom of Hawaii]].
*[[1899]] &ndash; The United States takes possession of [[Wake Island]] in the Pacific Ocean.
*[[1903]] &ndash; [[El Yunque National Forest]] in [[Puerto Rico]] becomes part of the United States [[National Forest System]] as the Luquillo Forest Reserve.
*[[1904]] &ndash; [[Anton Chekhov]]'s ''[[The Cherry Orchard]]'' receives its premiere performance at the [[Moscow Art Theatre]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; Captain [[Robert Falcon Scott]] [[Terra Nova Expedition|reaches the South Pole]], one month after [[Roald Amundsen]].
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[Raymond Poincaré]] is elected [[President of France]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; The United States pays Denmark {{$}}25 million for the [[U.S. Virgin Islands|Virgin Islands]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Finnish Civil War]]: The first serious battles take place between the [[Red Guards (Finland)|Red Guards]] and the [[White Guard (Finland)|White Guard]].
*[[1929]] &ndash; [[Popeye|Popeye the Sailor Man]], a [[cartoon]] [[fictional character|character]] created by [[E. C. Segar|Elzie Segar]], first appears in the [[Thimble Theatre]] [[comic strip]].
*  1929   &ndash; [[Inayatullah Khan]], king of the [[Emirate of Afghanistan]] abdicates the throne after only three days.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[Franco-Thai War]]: [[Vichy France|French]] forces [[Battle of Ko Chang|inflict a decisive defeat]] over the [[Royal Thai Navy]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Greek submarine Papanikolis (Y-2)|Greek submarine Papanikolis]] captures the 200-ton sailing vessel ''Agios Stefanos'' and mans her with part of her crew.
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] forces launch the first of [[Battle of Monte Cassino|four assaults]] on [[Monte Cassino]] with the intention of breaking through the [[Winter Line]] and seizing [[Rome]], an effort that would ultimately take four months and cost 105,000 Allied casualties.
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] forces capture the almost completely destroyed Polish city of [[Warsaw]].
*  1945   &ndash; The [[Nazi Germany|Nazis]] begin the evacuation of the [[Auschwitz concentration camp]] as Soviet forces close in.
*  1945   &ndash; Swedish diplomat [[Raoul Wallenberg]] is taken into [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] custody while in Hungary; he is never publicly seen again.
*[[1946]] &ndash; The [[UN Security Council]] holds its first session.
*[[1949]] &ndash; ''[[The Goldbergs (broadcast series)|The Goldbergs]]'', the first [[Situation comedy|sitcom]] on American [[television]], airs for the first time.
*[[1950]] &ndash; The [[Great Brinks Robbery]] &ndash; 11 thieves steal more than {{$}}2 million from an armored car company's offices in [[Boston]], [[Massachusetts]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]] delivers a televised [[Eisenhower's farewell address|farewell address to the nation]] three days before leaving office, in which he warns against the accumulation of power by the "[[military-industrial complex]]" as well as the dangers of massive spending, especially deficit spending.
*  1961   &ndash; Former [[Republic of the Congo (Léopoldville)|Congolese]] Prime Minister [[Patrice Lumumba]] is murdered in circumstances suggesting the support and complicity of the governments of Belgium and the United States.
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[1966 Palomares B-52 crash|Palomares incident]]: A [[B-52 Stratofortress|B-52]] bomber collides with a [[KC-135 Stratotanker]] over Spain, killing seven airmen, and dropping three 70-kiloton [[B28 nuclear bomb|nuclear bombs]] near the town of [[Palomares, Almería|Palomares]] and another one into the sea.
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Black Panther Party]] members [[Bunchy Carter]] and [[John Huggins]] are killed during a meeting in Campbell Hall on the campus of [[UCLA]].
*  1969   &ndash; [[Marinella]] releases ''[[Stalia – Stalia]]''.
*[[1977]] &ndash; Convicted murderer [[Gary Gilmore]] is executed by a [[firing squad]] in [[Utah]], ending a ten-year moratorium on [[capital punishment]] in the United States.
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[President of the Philippines]] [[Ferdinand Marcos]] lifts [[Martial Law in the Philippines|martial law]] eight years and five months after declaring it.
*[[1982]] &ndash; "[[Cold Sunday]]": in numerous cities in the United States temperatures fall to their lowest levels in over 100 years.
*[[1983]] &ndash; The tallest department store in the world, [[Hudson's]] flagship store in downtown [[Detroit]], closes due to high cost of operating.
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Gulf War]]: [[Operation Desert Storm]] begins early in the morning. [[Iraq]] fires 8 [[Scud]] missiles into [[Israel]] in an unsuccessful bid to provoke Israeli retaliation.
*  1991   &ndash; [[Harald V of Norway|Harald V]] becomes [[Monarchy of Norway|King of Norway]] on the death of his father, [[Olav V of Norway|Olav V]].
*[[1992]] &ndash; During a visit to South Korea, [[Prime Minister of Japan|Japanese Prime Minister]] [[Kiichi Miyazawa]] apologizes for forcing Korean women into [[Comfort women|sexual slavery]] during [[World War II]].
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[1994 Northridge earthquake]]: A magnitude 6.7 [[earthquake]] hits [[Northridge, California]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; The [[Great Hanshin earthquake]]: A magnitude 7.3 [[earthquake]] occurs near [[Kobe, Japan]], causing extensive property damage and killing 6,434 people.
*[[1996]] &ndash; The Czech Republic applies for membership of the [[European Union]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; A [[Delta 2]] carrying a [[Global Positioning System|GPS2R]] satellite explodes 13 seconds after launch, dropping 250 tons of burning rocket remains around the launch pad.
*[[1998]] &ndash; [[Lewinsky scandal]]: [[Matt Drudge]] breaks the story of the [[Bill Clinton]]-[[Monica Lewinsky]] affair on his website ''[[The Drudge Report]]''.
*[[2001]] &ndash; U.S. President Bill Clinton posthumously promotes [[William Clark (explorer)|William Clark]] from [[Lieutenant]] to [[Captain (U.S. Army)|Captain]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[Mount Nyiragongo]] erupts in the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]], displacing an estimated 400,000 people.
*[[2007]] &ndash; The [[Doomsday Clock]] is set to five minutes to midnight in response to [[North Korea]] nuclear testing.
*[[2008]] &ndash; [[British Airways Flight 38]] crash lands just short of [[London Heathrow Airport]] in England with no fatalities. It is the first complete [[Write-off|hull loss]] of a [[Boeing 777]].
*[[2010]] &ndash; [[2010 Jos riots|Rioting]] begins between [[Muslim]] and [[Christian]] groups in [[Jos]], [[Nigeria]], resulting in at least 200 deaths.
